unnormalised: Environmental News: Renewable Energy Boost for Rural Maharashtra!
normalised: Environmental News: Renewable Energy Boost for Rural Maharashtra!

unnormalised: Guess what folks? Big news coming out of Maharashtra! The Maharashtra Energy Development Agency (MEDA) just announced a major push for renewable energy projects in the Vidarbha region.
normalised: Guess what folks? Big news coming out of Maharashtra! The Maharashtra Energy Development Agency (M E D A) just announced a major push for renewable energy projects in the Vidarbha region.

unnormalised: We’re talking solar panels popping up on rooftops from Nagpur to Chandrapur, and even small-scale wind turbine installations in the more windy areas. Dr. Patil, the head of MEDA, says this initiative aims to bring electricity to remote villages currently facing power shortages.
normalised: We’re talking solar panels popping up on rooftops from Nagpur to Chandrapur, and even small-scale wind turbine installations in the more windy areas. Doctor Patil, the head of M E D A, says this initiative aims to bring electricity to remote villages currently facing power shortages.

unnormalised: This isn't just about lighting homes. Farmers can use solar-powered pumps to irrigate their fields, potentially boosting crop yields. Imagine the impact on the lives of people like Ramdas Kaka, who can finally access reliable electricity!
normalised: This isn't just about lighting homes. Farmers can use solar-powered pumps to irrigate their fields, potentially boosting crop yields. Imagine the impact on the lives of people like Ramdas Kaka, who can finally access reliable electricity!

unnormalised: The government is offering subsidies, making it easier for villagers to adopt these technologies. Initial estimates suggest at least 500,000 sq ft of solar panels will be installed in the first phase.
normalised: The government is offering subsidies, making it easier for villagers to adopt these technologies. Initial estimates suggest at least five hundred thousand square feet of solar panels will be installed in the first phase.

unnormalised: The project involves collaboration with IIT Bombay, providing technical expertise. Funding comes partly from the central government, with additional investments from private companies. The estimated cost is around Rs. 75 crores. This move promises not only a greener future but also economic upliftment for rural communities. More updates coming soon!
normalised: The project involves collaboration with I I T Bombay, providing technical expertise. Funding comes partly from the central government, with additional investments from private companies. The estimated cost is around rupees seventy five crores. This move promises not only a greener future but also economic upliftment for rural communities. More updates coming soon!
